paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a deletion-frameshift mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with congenital long QT syndrome type 2, detailing penetrance data and individual case information.

patients.demographics: Chinese Han, 31-year-old female proband, her father, and her son

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short PR interval, prolonged QT, bifid T-wave, syncope
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The female proband... showed a positive reaction to lidocaine attenuation test.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged QT, subtle notched T-wave, no symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: According to the QTc and Schwartz score, the proband and her father and son were clinically diagnosed as LQTS, however, the father and son were asymptomatic.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Short PR interval, prolonged QT, notched T-wave, no symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: According to the QTc and Schwartz score, the proband and her father and son were clinically diagnosed as LQTS, however, the father and son were asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The mutation causes a frameshift mutation after the amino acid 1033 (Arginine), replacing the original 126 amino acids with 78 novel amino acids.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with the disease in the proband and her father, but not in other family members.
variants.additional_notes: This variant was first reported as a putative LQTS-associated mutation by Jamie in 2009.
key_quotes: This heterozygous mutation resides in the distal C-terminus of the Kv11.1 channel.
The mutation was screened in genomic DNAs of all family members by Sanger sequencing.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical characteristics of family members in a Chinese Han family with LQTS.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
